ns.desc:
The Numbers Suite is a series of plugins that allow for...
  1. zeroPad - a number of zeroes to the beginning of a number
  2. randomNumber - generate a random number with a specific number of digits
  3. twoDecimals - round a number to the closest hundreth (for currency)

This plugin suite is depricated.
ns.name: Numbers Suite

pt.desc: Executes a function on a list of Adobe Analytics variables. For example, the following function will run the clearVars function three times, once using eVar1 as the argument, once using eVar4 as the argument, and once using eVar29 as the argument. The end result clear out the values of eVar1, eVar4 & eVar29. s.pt('eVar1,eVar4,eVar29', ',', 'clearVars');
pt.name: pt

apl.desc: Add new values to list-delimited variables (e.g. events, linkTrackVars, listVars, etc.). This plugin requires "inList" to be initialized as well.
apl.name: Append To List

rfl.desc: Remove values from list-delimited variables (e.g. s.events, s.linkTrackVars, listVars, etc.).
rfl.name: Remove From List

p_fo.desc: Checks for the existence of a specific JavaScript object. If the object doesn't exist, the plugin creates the object and returns the value of true. This would be the first and only time the plugin would create this object on the current page (hence the name, pageFirstOnly). If the JavaScript object already exists on the page, the function will return the value of false.
p_fo.name: First Page Only

inList.desc: Check whether a value already exists within either a delimited list of values or a JavaScript array object.
inList.name: In List

cleanStr.desc: Remove unnecessary characters from a string (or string variable), including HTML tag characters, Extra whitespaces (including double spaces), Left/right single quotes (‘’) (replaced with straight single quotes), Tabs, Newlines/Carriage Returns.
cleanStr.name: Clean String

formatTime.desc: Take a specified number of seconds and present them in a bucketed format, rounded to a benchmark value that you specify. The "inList" plugin is required by this plugin. This plugin requires "inList" to be initialized as well.
formatTime.name: Format Time

getValOnce.desc: Prevents a variable from being set equal to the same value on consecutive calls.
getValOnce.name: Value Once

manageVars.desc: Manipulate the values of multiple Adobe Analytics variables at one time; this version includes specific functionality to lowercase or remove unnecessary characters from multiple variable values at the same time.
manageVars.name: Manage Variables

getPageName.desc: Creates a value that can be inserted into the Adobe Analytics pageName variable and that is an easy-to-read, "friendly"-formatted version of the current URL.
getPageName.name: Page Name

getVisitNum.desc: Visit number for all visitors that come to the site within a specific time period (e.g. "x" number of days).
getVisitNum.name: Visit Number

getNewRepeat.desc: Determines whether a visitor to the site is a new visitor or a repeat visitor within the number of days that is specified in the plugin call.
getNewRepeat.name: New Repeat

getQueryParam.desc: Case-insensitively extract the value of any query string parameter contained in a URL. This plugin requires "pt" to be initialized as well.
getQueryParam.name: Query Parameter

addProductEvar.desc: Easily add an Adobe Analytics merchandising eVar that uses product syntax to the products variable (s.products) without worrying whether the already-existing contents of the variable will be changed/moved/deleted.
addProductEvar.name: Add Product eVar

getTimeParting.desc: Capture the details of the time when any measurable activity takes place on its site.
getTimeParting.name: Time Parting

addProductEvent.desc: Easily add an Adobe Analytics custom numeric event or custom currency event to the products variable (s.products) without worrying whether the already-existing contents of the variable will be changed/moved/deleted.
addProductEvent.name: Add Product Event

getPageLoadTime.desc: Uses the JavaScript performance object to allow you to measure the amount of time a page takes to load completely. This plugin requires "p_fo" to be initialized as well.
getPageLoadTime.name: Page Load Time

getPreviousValue.desc: Set an Analytics variable equal to the value of a variable that was set on a previous page or contained in a previous image request. This plugin requires "p_fo" to be initialized as well.
getPreviousValue.name: Previous Value

getVisitDuration.desc: Amount of time (in minutes) that the visitor has been on the site up to that point.
getVisitDuration.name: Visit Duration

getGeoCoordinates.desc: Returns the geographic location (latitude and longitude) of the visitors device.
getGeoCoordinates.name: Geographic Coordinates

getTimeToComplete.desc: Time a user takes to complete a process on a site. The "clock" begins when the "start" action is called and ends when the "stop" action is called. This plugin requires "pt" to be initialized as well.
getTimeToComplete.name: Time To Complete

getAndPersistValue.desc: Stores a value in a cookie that can be retrieved later during a visit.
getAndPersistValue.name: Persist Value

getResponsiveLayout.desc: Which version of your responsive design-based website a visitor is currently looking at.
getResponsiveLayout.name: Responsive Layout

getPercentPageViewed.desc: Measures a visitor's scroll activity to see how much of the page they viewed before moving to another page.
getPercentPageViewed.name: Percent Page Viewed

getTimeBetweenEvents.desc: Amount of time between two different Adobe Analytics events (custom or otherwise). This plugin requires "inList" to be initialized as well.
getTimeBetweenEvents.name: Time Between Events

getDaysSinceLastVisit.desc: Returns the number of days since the visitor's last (most recent) visit. This plugin is deprecated. Adobe recommends using the getTimeSinceLastVisit plugin instead.
getDaysSinceLastVisit.name: Days Since Last Visit

getTimeSinceLastVisit.desc: Returns the time since the visitor's last (most recent) visit.
getTimeSinceLastVisit.name: Time Since Last Visit
